entries.title: Musk's Twitter reportedly hasn't paid rent on its office spaces for weeks
entries.description: Elon Musk has recently taken drastic steps to cut costs and gear up for possible legal battles at Twitter, according to a report from The New York Times.

entries.title: Tesla shares have fallen 28% since Elon Musk took over Twitter, lagging other carmakers
entries.description: Musk sold billions of dollars worth of his Tesla holdings to finance the Twitter takeover and has been embroiled in controversy ever since.

entries.title: The Arctic is getting warmer and stormier, and ship traffic is increasing as ice melts
entries.description: Nearly 150 Arctic scientists from 11 countries developed this year's Arctic Report Card.

entries.title: CFTC piles on with new charges against Bankman-Fried, FTX and Alameda
entries.description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission alleged that FTX commingled customer funds and that ex-CEO Sam Bankman-Fried violated the Commodities Exchange Act.

entries.title: Two Americans and five Russians charged with running a smuggling network to obtain military technology and ammunition for Russia
entries.description: Two American citizens and five Russian nationals were charged with smuggling sensitive military technology and ammunition to benefit the Kremlin.

entries.title: Workers and consumers say they're likely to favor pro-LGBTQ businesses, new study says
entries.description: A new report reveals companies that stay silent on LGBTQ issues could turn off their customers and employees.

entries.title: Why tech insiders are so excited about ChatGPT, a chatbot that answers questions and writes essays
entries.description: Since OpenAI released ChatGPT last month, the text-based artificial intelligence tool has gone viral, attracting a million users in its first five days.

entries.title: The Fed has to portray itself as tough on inflation even as it pushes through a smaller rate hike
entries.description: The Fed is expected to raise interest rates by a smaller half percentage point Wednesday yet signal that its battle with inflation is still far from over.

entries.title: Apple launches a big update that makes your iPhone backups more secure. Here's how to turn it on
entries.description: If you opt-in to Apple's Advanced Data Protection, then Apple Photos, Notes and iCloud backups won't be accessible to anyone but you.

entries.title: Harvard-educated deception expert: 4 red flags can show when people like Sam Bankman-Fried are lying
entries.description: Pamela Meyer, a Harvard-educated deception expert and certified fraud examiner, weighs in on disgraced founders Elizabeth Holmes and Sam Bankman-Fried.

entries.title: Ford boosts production of electric F-150 Lightning pickup truck
entries.description: Ford Motor has added a third production shift to its Michigan plant that produces the electric F-150 Lightning as it looks to boost output.

entries.title: Lawmakers unveil bipartisan bill that aims to ban TikTok in the U.S.
entries.description: The bill comes after years of broad concern across the Trump and Biden administrations about potential Chinese government influence on the company.

entries.title: Nuclear fusion just passed a major milestone: Generating more energy than used to create the reaction
entries.description: The National Lab and Department of Energy announced a nuclear reaction that generated more energy than was required to power it -- a first for humankind.

entries.title: Sam Bankman-Fried criminal charges unsealed: Conspiracy to defraud the U.S., wire fraud, securities fraud, and money laundering
entries.description: Federal prosecutors unsealed charges against disgraced FTX co-founder Sam Bankman-Fried.

entries.title: Here’s the inflation breakdown for November 2022 — in one chart
entries.description: Inflation was cooler than expected in November amid a slowdown in several broad consumer categories, according to the consumer price index issued Tuesday.

entries.title: FTX spent $256 million on Bahamas real estate — now the island's government wants it back
entries.description: Bahamas regulators appeal to U.S. bankruptcy judge to try to claim ownership over FTX-owned properties in New Providence, Bahamas.

entries.title: European Union reaches landmark agreement on a pollution tax for imports
entries.description: The EU has a goal to cut greenhouse gas emissions by at least 55% by the year 2030, compared to 1990.

entries.title: Consumer prices rose less than expected in November, up 7.1% from a year ago
entries.description: The consumer price index was expected to increase 0.3% in November, according to Dow Jones estimates.

entries.title: Europe moves closer on limiting natural gas prices as Brussels looks to protect consumers
entries.description: Energy ministers of the EU are discussing details over a cap on natural gas prices, but diviosn over the policy remain.

entries.title: Blizzard seeks new partners to continue offering World of Warcraft in China
entries.description: Blizzard is set to discontinue game services in China from January 2023 after failing to renew a 14-year contract with Chinese gaming giant NetEase.

entries.title: Bank of England calls for 'urgent' global action after near-collapse of UK pension funds
entries.description: The Bank of England called for "urgent international action" from regulators after it was forced to rescue U.K. pension funds in September.

entries.title: China brings WTO case against U.S. and its sweeping chip export curbs as tech tensions escalate
entries.description: China initiated a dispute against the U.S. at the World Trade Organization over Washington's sweeping semiconductor export curbs.

entries.title: Antibiotics prices surge in UK amid Strep A outbreak, leaving drugstores 'footing the bill'
entries.description: Drugstores are warning of shortages of key antibiotics used to treat Strep A, as cases rise in the U.K.

entries.title: European Parliament removes Eva Kaili as vice-president after Qatar corruption allegations
entries.description: The European Parliament on Tuesday ousted a lawmaker who was arrested over the weekend in an investigation into alleged bribes by Qatar.

entries.title: United Airlines is buying at least 100 Boeing Dreamliners to replace aging wide-body jets
entries.description: The massive order is a big boost for Boeing from one of its largest customers.

entries.title: Binance temporarily halts withdrawals of stablecoin USDC as investor concerns mount after FTX collapse
entries.description: Changpeng Zhao, CEO of Binance, tweeted on Tuesday that the exchange is seeing an increase in withdrawals of USDC.

entries.title: Indian and Chinese forces sustained injuries in clash, Indian defence ministry says
entries.description: Indian and Chinese troops engaged and sustained injuries at a disputed Himalayan frontier.

entries.title: Copper prices — traditionally a barometer for the global economy — are expected to soar next year
entries.description: Copper — traditionally seen as a leading indicator of economic health because of its use in many sectors — has unsurprisingly had a rough year. Yet analysts expect a resurgence in 2023.

entries.title: Sam Bankman-Fried has been arrested following FTX collapse. Here's what happens next
entries.description: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried was arrested on Monday in the Bahamas. He could face a lengthy prison sentence.

entries.title: India and Vietnam could benefit as chipmakers shift away from China
entries.description: The Biden administration's China chip curbs are prompting chipmakers to relocate production chains to neighboring countries, experts say.

entries.title: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried arrested in the Bahamas after U.S. files criminal charges
entries.description: Sam Bankman-Fried's arrest is the first concrete move by regulators to hold individuals accountable for the multi-billion dollar implosion of FTX last month.
